LanguageData.RawPoisonMushroom.label: wild mushrooms
LanguageData.EggButterflyFertilized.label: butterfly egg (fert.)
LanguageData.EggButterflyFertilized.description: Fertilized butterfly egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby butterfly. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.Silk.label: silk
LanguageData.PoisonPlantTallGrass.label: tall grass
LanguageData.PoisonPlantTallGrass.description: Wild tall grass. Slows down anyone moving over it.
LanguageData.PoisonPlantTreeTeak.label: teak tree
LanguageData.PoisonPlantTreeTeak.description: An exceptionally strong hardwood tree that grows in warm climates. Because teak wood is so durable and water-resistant, it was used to form the keel of wooden sailing ships in ancient times.
LanguageData.PoisonPlantTreeCecropia.label: cecropia tree
LanguageData.PoisonPlantTreeCecropia.description: One of the most common rainforest trees. Cecropia grows very fast, but yields little usable wood.
LanguageData.PoisonPlantRaspberry.label: raspberry bush
LanguageData.PoisonPlantRaspberry.description: A bushy wild plant which yields delicious berries. Berries can be cooked, but they're also good to eat even when raw.
LanguageData.PoisonPlantBush.label: bush
LanguageData.PoisonPlantBush.description: A short shrub. Does not typically talk.
LanguageData.PoisonPlantDandelion.label: dandelions
LanguageData.PoisonPlantDandelion.description: A tiny yellow flower which grows in large clusters. Though it is often considered a weed, dandelions in bloom are quite beautiful.
LanguageData.PoisonMushroom.label: wild mushroom
LanguageData.PoisonMushroom.description: An common wild fungus. It looks fleshy and edible.
LanguageData.PoisonAlocasia.label: poison alocasia
LanguageData.PoisonAlocasia.description: A tropical plant. Its extremely broad leaves are a commonly-recognized signifier of tropical forests.
LanguageData.PoisonBrambles.label: poison brambles
LanguageData.PoisonBrambles.description: A tropical plant. Its extremely broad leaves are a commonly-recognized signifier of tropical forests.
LanguageData.PoisonRafflesia.label: poison rafflesia
LanguageData.PoisonRafflesia.description: A tropical plant. Its extremely broad leaves are a commonly-recognized signifier of tropical forests.
LanguageData.PoisonShrub.label: poison shrub
LanguageData.PoisonShrub.description: A short shrub. Does not typically talk.
LanguageData.PoisonTreeCypress.label: cypress tree
LanguageData.PoisonTreeCypress.description: One of the most common rainforest trees. Cypress grows very fast, but yields little usable wood.
LanguageData.PoisonTreePalm.label: palm tree
LanguageData.PoisonTreePalm.description: A tropical tree with a tall, naked trunk topped by a cluster of very broad leaves. Unfortunately, this variety doesn't produce any edible coconuts.
LanguageData.PoisonTreeWillow.label: willow tree
LanguageData.PoisonTreeWillow.description: One of the fastest growing shade trees, willows provide a beautiful, leafy canopy. It doesn't yield much usable wood.
LanguageData.PlantTallYellowGrass.label: tall grass
LanguageData.PlantTallYellowGrass.description: Wild tall grass. Significantly slows down anyone moving over it.
LanguageData.SavannaTreeAcacia.label: acacia tree
LanguageData.SavannaTreeAcacia.description: Native to subtropical regions throughout the world, the acacia trees grow in the harshest climates.
LanguageData.SavannaBush.label: bush
LanguageData.SavannaBush.description: A short shrub. Does not typically talk.
LanguageData.SavannaTreeBaobab.label: baobab tree
LanguageData.SavannaTreeBaobab.description: A large round tree native to tropical savannas.
LanguageData.TreeCedar.label: redcedar tree
LanguageData.TreeCedar.description: Native to the temperate rainforests, redcedar is a riprarian tree, growing in many forested swamps and streambanks.
LanguageData.SwordFern.label: sword fern
LanguageData.SwordFern.description: Sword fern populates the understory of moist coniferous forests at low elevations. It grows best in a well-drained acidic soil of rich humus and small stones.
LanguageData.TreeDead.label: dead tree
LanguageData.TreeDead.description: A sick tree. It barely manages to survive.
LanguageData.WetlandTreeMangrove.label: mangrove tree
LanguageData.WetlandTreeMangrove.description: A mangrove is a shrub or small tree that grows in coastal saline or brackish water.
LanguageData.PoisonDeer.label: deer
LanguageData.PoisonDeer.description: A medium-sized herding herbivore. Generally peaceful unless disturbed.
LanguageData.PoisonRat.label: rat
LanguageData.PoisonRat.description: A rodent famous for soiling kitchens and spreading disease. Eats almost anything; lives almost anywhere.
LanguageData.MutantCow.label: cow
LanguageData.MutantCow.description: A very common domestic animal. It can produce large amounts of milk, or be slaughtered for delicious food.
LanguageData.PoisonButterfly.label: butterfly
LanguageData.PoisonButterfly.description: Butterflies are beautiful, flying insects with large scaly wings. Butterflies are caterpillers which have completed metamorphasis.
LanguageData.PoisonButterfly.tools.1.label: head
